summary.p: 9 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 22; Qurʾānic Text: Q 7:32-7:46, Q 7:64-8:2; 17 lines per page; Dimensions: 189 x 135/138mm; Script style: kūfī B.II.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
9 fol. 135/138×189 mm (1.4). Support: parchment, slightly transparent. Writing material: light brown ink.

Collation: one incomplete quire, S H1F H2F H3F H4F/F5H F6H F7H F8H F9H; fol. 8 is a single folio with a stub, all others are bifolia (fol. 1 and 9 presently detached from each other); one folio missing between fol. 1 and 2.
Text layout: 84×135 mm (1.6), 17 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: B II, quite small. Diacritics and vocalization: absent.
Verse markers: individual verses – 3 diagonal dashes (type 1.1.1), in the same ink as the main text; groups of 10 verses – red circles (type 1.A.I).
Traces of old conservation: tear on fol. 8 stitched; upper margins probably cropped.
Defects: stains; the parchment has become dark; lower margins are damaged close to the fold line; ink has partly peeled off on the flesh side.

Attached materials: 19th century cardboard wrapper not attached to the manuscript, the upper cover inscribed in pencil with letter “R” and “No. 22 / 17 lignes” (fol. I); a small sheet of paper with the description of the manuscript in French written in brown ink (fol. II).
Old accession numbers: R (on the wrapper), A. 22 (inscribed on the wrapper, also according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–1v. Surah 7, verses 30(32)–44(46). Incipit: [والطيِّبات] مِن الرِزق. Explicit: سلام عليكم [لم يَدخلوها] .
Fol. 2r–9v. Surah 7, verses 62(64) –205(206)*. Incipit: [فأنجيناه] والذين معه.
Fol. 9v. Surah 8, verses 1(1) –2(2). Explicit: وإذا تُلِيَتْ [عليهم اياتُهُ] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
